body.p:
Hopkinsville Ky April 6th 1864
To Thos. E. Bramlett Governor of Kentucky

I herby offer my resignation as one of the managers of the Western Lunatic Assylum, being in the act of moving to Louisville Ky, with kind regards for the institution, and best wishes for its future success I am Respectfully

Your Obedient
Servant
S. M. Bernard

At a meeting of the Board of Managers of the Western Lanatic Asylum ^this day^ They instructed me to recommend to you Richard Durritt ^Durrett^ as a suitable person to fill the vacancy occasioned by the resignation of S M Bernard

Geo. Pindexter Chm
April 7th 1864
J. B. Gowen Sect

Western Lunatic Asylum Resignation of & appointment
11th Apr 1864
Resignation accepted & Richard Durret appointed as recommended
